title.rendered: 10 Best Graphic Design Courses for Beginners to Take in 2023

content.rendered:
What comes to mind when I say “graphic design”? For me, it’s the banners for our articles (like the one above). But graphic design can be anything: posters, book covers, YouTube thumbnails, advertisements, logos, and so much more. It’s all about setting your imagination free!

In this guide, I’ve selected the 10 best free and paid Graphic Design online courses for you from the 820+ Graphic Design courses, from comprehensive university-level graphic design specialization to YouTube tutorials for beginners, there are options for all needs!

But if you want to jump straight to the results, here are my top 10 picks. You can click on a course to jump to the corresponding section:

Course Workload In Brief
1. Become a Graphic Designer (LinkedIn Learning) 27 hours Best collection of courses to learn graphic design
2. Beginners guide to Graphic Design (Gareth David Studio) 6 hours Free course to learn graphic design, one of the most popular ones on YouTube
3. Graphic Design (CalArts) 78 hours Best university specialization for beginners to learn graphic design, free to audit
4. The Complete Graphic Design Theory for Beginners Course (Udemy) 10 hours Great graphic design online course for beginners to learn graphic design theory
5. Graphic Design (Colorado Boulder) 29 hours Practical and application-focused university course to learn graphic design, free to audit
6. Graphic Design Masterclass – Learn GREAT Design (Udemy) 28 hours Covers everything from graphic design theory to software Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign
7. Graphic Design Theory (Yes I’m a Designer) 3-4 hours Easy and to-the-point, free YouTube course to learn graphic design theory
8. Graphic Design Tips & Tricks (LinkedIn Learning) 11 hours Useful course to learn graphic design tips and tricks with real-world examples
9. Graphic design mini courses from MICA (Skillshare) 2-3 hours Collection of 2 short graphic design courses by famous designer and author from MICA
10. Introduction to Graphic Design (LinkedIn Learning) 4-5 hours Good for learning graphic design theory and software, comes with free certificate

What is Graphic Design?

According to the American Institute of Graphic Arts (AIGA), graphic design may be defined as “the art and practice of planning and projecting ideas and experiences with visual and textual content.” One way to think of this is that, graphic design means taking graphical and textual elements and creating meaningful visuals out of them (mainly using technology).

Graphic designs usually have a purpose, such as commercial advertisements, but can also be used purely as a form of artistic expression. The main intention is to convey a message to the viewer in order to connect with them.

Why are Graphic Design Skills Important?

According to the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, the median annual wage for graphic designers was $50,710 in May 2021.

Employment of graphic designers is projected to grow 3 percent from now to 2031, while, on average, about 24,800 graphic designing jobs in the U.S. are projected each year over the decade.

However, even though the need for digitally based graphic design is growing, a decrease in print media may limit opportunities for graphic designers who create print-based publications.

In a 2021 article, Forbes said that AI is making its way into the world of graphic design. Technology is bringing sophisticated design tools to us, replicating human human work and providing a more efficient outcome. However, as long as we make the correct use of technology, AI cannot replace human touch, and graphic designers will still be in the market.

What is My Experience with Graphic Design?

I love graphic designing. Even though I come from a technical background, it does not stop me from expressing myself through art. Previously, I’ve designed presentations, posters, logos, thumbnails, book covers, birthday cards and nameplates using Adobe Photoshop, Canva and Microsoft PowerPoint. I’m constantly influenced by professionals, and aspire to become one of them.

Recently, I’ve started designing banners and visual assets on Figma for my BCGs: Email Marketing, Affiliate Marketing, English Grammar, Adobe Lightroom, Photography, and this one. After joining Class Central, I’ve been inspired by my friend, @kiri, our designer, and together we’ve created banners for my BCGs Microsoft Excel and Microsoft Power BI.

Besides that, I am a Guided Project Instructor and a Beta Tester at Coursera, having tested many courses before they’re officially launched. I have taken over 50 online courses in various subjects.

My experience as an online learner and teacher has given me some perspective on what to look for in an online course. I used my experience to evaluate each course in this list.

Course Ranking Methodology

I built this ranking following the now tried-and-tested methodology I used in previous rankings (you can find them all here). It involves a three-step process:

  1. Research: I started by leveraging Class Central’s database with 100K online courses and 200K+ reviews. Then, I made a preliminary selection of 820+ Graphic Design courses by rating, reviews, and bookmarks.
  2. Evaluate: I read through reviews on Class Central, Reddit, and course providers to understand what other learners thought about each course and combined it with my own experience as a learner.
  3. Select: Well-made courses were picked if they presented valuable and engaging content and they have to fit in a set of criteria and be ranked accordingly: comprehensive curriculum, release date, affordability, ratings and enrollments.

The end result is a unique selection of courses that combines a decade of Class Central data and my own experience as an online learner to try to get the best of both worlds. So far, I’ve spent more than 17 hours building this list, and I’ll continue to update it.

Course Ranking Statistics

Here are some statistics regarding this course ranking:

  • Combined, these courses have accrued over 982.4K enrollments.
  • 6 courses are free or free-to-audit and 4 courses are paid.
  • The most-represented course provider in the ranking is LinkedIn Learning, with 3 courses.
  • All 10  courses are in English.
  • Combined, these courses have been bookmarked over 3K times on Class Central, while the Graphic Design subject is followed by over 11.7K learners on Class Central, and accounts for over 820K courses in Class Central catalog.

So without further ado, let’s get to my picks for the best Graphic Design online courses.

1. Become a Graphic Designer (LinkedIn Learning)

My first pick for the best Graphic Design online course is Become a Graphic Designer on LinkedIn Learning.

This is a collection of 11  graphic design courses. Each course teaches a specific aspect of graphic design, from basic concepts and technicalities to graphic design software such as Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign. Once you complete all 11 courses, you’ll get a certificate from LinkedIn Learning.

The first two courses (short and introductory) offer a free certificate from LinkedIn Learning! Check out this link to find out more free courses available for Graphic Designers on LinkedIn Learning.

What You’ll Learn

What is Graphic Design?

In this introductory course, you’ll learn about graphic design and how it is used to convey ideas and concepts. You’ll understand how good design impacts the success of you and your business.

Graphic Design Careers: First Steps (3 modules)

In this course, you’ll discover the most important skills, tools, and techniques for graphic designers, and where to find training to get stare\ted in your career as a graphic designer.

Introduction to Graphic Design: Concepts (5 modules)

In this course, you’ll explore the core design skills in color, typography, and layout. You’ll learn how you can apply these important skills in your designs.

Graphic Design Foundations: Layout and Composition (6 modules)

In this course, you’ll understand the how, why, and when of layout and composition so that you can make your designs stronger, clearer, more attention-grabbing.

Graphic Design Foundations: Typography (8 modules)

In this course, you’ll explore good typographic practices. You’ll learn how to select and use type to add impact, how type is measured, and how factors like spacing and alignment affect your design.

Color for Design and Art (6 modules)

In this course, you’ll learn about the practical application of color theory. This includes how to create color palettes, manipulate colors in Adobe tools like Photoshop and Illustrator, fix color problems, and more.

InDesign 2021 Essential Training (13 modules)

In this course, you’ll take a look at one of the best page-layout applications in the world, Adobe InDesign. You’ll learn how to use the 2021 version of Adobe InDesign.

Photoshop 2021 Essential Training: The Basics (18 modules)

In this course, you’ll learn how to work with Adobe Photoshop 2021. You’ll explore the core features of Adobe Photoshop, including key imaging concepts.

Illustrator 2021 Essential Training (23 modules)

In this course, you’ll explore the world’s leading illustration and vector drawing application, Adobe Illustrator. You’ll learn how to create artwork for print, the web, or use in other applications.

Creative Collaboration (5 modules)

In this course, you’ll learn how to design collectively with your team. You’ll learn the latest approaches to creative collaboration so that you can create better designs together.

Color Trends (3 modules)

In this course, you’ll understand all about colors. You’ll learn how to use the 2020 Pantone color of the year—Classic Blue—and other color trends in your designs.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 11 subcourses. Each module involves about 15 to 20 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, quizzes and practice exercises.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor Sean Adams, Cara St.Hilaire, Tony Harmer, Sean Adams, Ina Saltz, Jim Krause, David Blatner, Julieanne Kost, Tony Harmer, Denise Jacobs, Nicte Cuevas
Level Beginner
Workload 27 hours
Enrollments 982K
Rating 4.7/5 (15,974 reviews in total)
Certificate Free

Fun Facts

  • This learning path qualifies for official academic credit at select partner universities globally.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

2. Beginners guide to Graphic Design (Gareth David Studio)

My second pick for the best Graphic Design online course is the free course, Beginners guide to Graphic Design, offered by Gareth David Studio on YouTube.

This is one of the most popular graphic design courses on YouTube taught by designer Gareth David. And it’s free! Though aimed at beginners, no matter where you are in your graphic design journey, this course will be super helpful for you to get started as a graphic designer.

What You’ll Learn

You’ll begin the course by understanding what graphic design is. You’ll learn about the visual elements like line, color, shape, texture, space, form and typography, and design principles like contrast, hierarchy, alignment, balance, proximity, repetition, simplicity and function.

Next, you’ll learn if you should do graphic design and why. You’ll know what practical skills, psychological skills and talent you need to be a graphic designer, how to begin as a graphic designer by learning and researching, collecting, being inspired, practicing and seeking education.

Then, you’ll take a look at the books to read and education needed as a graphic designer, whether you need to go to university, qualifications and equipment needed to be a graphic designer, and programs needed as a graphic designer.

After that, you’ll learn about the graphic design portfolio, whether you should make a print or digital graphic design portfolio, the graphic design CV, career change to be a graphic designer, beginning as a graphic designer by applying your skills, and finding a graphic design job.

Finally, you’ll explore interview preparation to be a graphic designer, questions asked and to ask at a graphic design interview, interview tips to be a graphic designer, what the industry is like for a graphic designer, and how to further your graphic design career and the necessary education.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 46 videos. Each video involves about 5 to 10 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Channel Gareth David Studio
Provider YouTube
Instructor Gareth David
Level Beginner
Workload 6 hours
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • David has 14+ years of experience working for 35+ design studios.
  • He is also a mentor at Kingston University
  • He has 560K+ subscribers to his YouTube channel and lots of free resources on his website.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

3. Graphic Design (California Institute of the Arts)

My third pick for the best Graphic Design online course is the free-to-audit Graphic Design, offered by California Institute of the Arts on Coursera.

This four-part specialization will teach you all that you need to know in order to create eye-catching designs: process, historical context, and communication through image-making and typography. These skills will prepare you to pursue formal studies in graphic design, so that you can take your graphic design skills further.

What You’ll Learn

Fundamentals of Graphic Design (4 weeks)

In this course you’ll learn the fundamental principles of graphic design like imagemaking, typography, composition, working with color and shape – foundational skills that form the base in all areas of graphic design.

Introduction to Typography (4 weeks)

In this course, you’ll study, name, and measure the characteristics of letterforms. You’ll take a look at the history of typefaces, discuss the best practices in setting type, and explore the expressive, meaning-making potential of type.

Introduction to Imagemaking (4 weeks)

In this course, you’ll experiment with a range of materials and techniques to make images for graphic design, expand your visual vocabulary, and learn how to make, manipulate and arrange images to create compositions.

Ideas from the History of Graphic Design (4 weeks)

In this course, you’ll explore ideas that helped formulate design practice from the 1850s through the 1960s to the ways that designers think today through social and cultural contexts, technologies, aesthetics, and politics of their eras.

Brand New Brand (6 weeks)

This course takes you through the entire design process, from ideation to creation to presentation. Through the guide, you will be creating and giving a visual identity to an imaginary start-up company, and applying that visual identity to a number of forms.

How You’ll Learn

This specialization is broken down into 5 courses, and each course is broken down into 4 modules , except the last one which is 6 weeks. Each module involves about 30 minutes to 1 hour of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and quizzes.

Institution California Institute of the Arts
Provider Coursera
Instructor Anther Kiley, Gail Swanlund, Lorraine Wild, Louise Sandhaus, Michael Worthington
Level Beginner
Workload 78 hours
Enrollments 286K
Rating 4.7/5.0 (14.3K)
Certificate Paid

One Thing to Note

Only learners who have earned a certificate in the four previous courses in the Specialization are eligible to take the Capstone.

Fun Facts

  • Worthington is the founding partner of Counterspace, a graphic design studio.
  • Kiley is a designer and design educator from Providence, RI.
  • Wild is a graphic designer from Los Angeles.
  • Sandhaus is the former Program Director of the Graphic Design Program at CalArts.
  • Swanlund is a graphic designer and writer.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

4. The Complete Graphic Design Theory for Beginners Course (Udemy)

My fourth pick for the best Graphic Design online course is The Complete Graphic Design Theory for Beginners Course on Udemy.

As the name suggests, this course contains all that you need to know in order to master graphic design theory. Knowing the fundamentals of graphic design such as color, typography, layout, composition and branding is extremely important, and this course teaches you just that. No prior experience is needed.

What You’ll Learn

You’ll begin the course by learning about graphic design theory. You’ll learn about graphic design practices and principles, creating real-world, applicable projects, applying graphic design fundamentals in everyday life, and how color theory applies to the world around us.

Then, you’ll understand typography theory and how type plays a major role in both print mediums and digital media, photography composition and how it interacts with graphic design elements, layout, user interface, experience design, and composition.

Finally, you’ll explore logo design and branding, past and current design trends, legal side of design such as copyright and trademarks, step-by-step process to becoming a graphic designer, and design trends to look out for.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 13 sections. Each section involves about 30 minutes to 2 hours of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and projects.

Provider Udemy
Instructor Lindsay Marsh, Jeremy Deighan
Level Beginner
Workload 10 hours
Enrollments 57K
Rating 4.6/5.0 (13.7K)
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Deighan has taught 260,000+ students on Udemy.
  • He has an Associate’s Degree in Computer Animation.
  • He has worked with various production houses.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

5. Graphic Design (University of Colorado Boulder)

My fifth pick for the best Graphic Design online course is the free-to-audit Graphic Design, offered by University of Colorado Boulder on Coursera.

This a a practical course that not only teaches you the theory and basics of graphic design, but actually encourages you to apply those concepts and create your own designs in basic presentation software such as Microsoft PowerPoint, Google Slides, or Apple Keynote, or even more sophisticated tools, such as Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign.

What You’ll Learn

In week 1, you’ll be introduced to the importance of recognizing good design. You’ll learn to establish a vocabulary of successful design and find inspiration for our own projects.

In week 2, you’ll learn the importance of working with a grid, negative space, appropriate margins, and the palette of elements. You’ll also cover type, color, images, and graphic elements such as borders, bars, and backgrounds.

In week 3, you’ll use the palette items covered in week 2, apply contrast, repetition, sublimation and tension, and cover the strategy of composition.

In week 4, you’ll understand what it means to be confident, yet open to criticism. You’ll explore the importance of revision, as well as the need to enlist feedback and keep distance in assessing our own work.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 4 modules. Each module involves about 4 to 10 hours of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and quizzes.

Institution University of Colorado Boulder
Provider Coursera
Instructor David Underwood
Level Beginner
Workload 29 hours
Enrollments 119K
Rating 4.8/5.0 (2.7K)
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • This course is part of the Effective Communication: Writing, Design, and Presentation specialization.
  • This course can be taken for academic credit as part of CU Boulder’s Master of Science in Data Science (MS-DS) degree.
  • Underwood has worked as an illustrator, designer, lecturer, and teaching consultant at CU Boulder since 1988.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

6. Graphic Design Masterclass – Learn GREAT Design (Udemy)

My sixth pick for the best Graphic Design online course is Graphic Design Masterclass – Learn GREAT Design on Udemy.

From design theory, branding and logo design to Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign, this covers just about all the aspects of graphic design. With this course, you’ll be able to apply your knowledge to real-world projects to create incredible designs.

What You’ll Learn

Things you’ll learn in this course are:

  • Typography, color theory, photos, layout and blocking
  • Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator, InDesign and Affinity Designer
  • Logos and branding packages
  • Package design process
  • Hierarchy, balance and overall design layout
  • History of fonts and typefaces and how to pair fonts
  • Step-by-step process to becoming a graphic designer
  • YouTube thumbnails and social media graphics
  • Giving and receiving criticism and feedback
  • Predicting and applying future design trends

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 34 sections. Each section involves about 30 minutes to 2 hours of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and projects.

Provider Udemy
Instructor Lindsay Marsh
Level Beginner
Workload 28 hours
Enrollments 167.7K
Rating 4.7/5.0 (43K)
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • Marsh has taught 300,000+ students globally online.
  • She has provided private tutoring in the area of design and marketing for over 8 years.
  • She’s also a certified Canva Certified Creative.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

7. Graphic Design Theory (Yes I’m a Designer)

My seventh pick for the best Graphic Design online course is the free course, Graphic Design Theory, offered by Yes I’m a Designer on YouTube.

Theory is indispensable to any subject, and so is it for graphic design. But for this course, you can learn all about graphic design theory for free! Designer Martin Perhiniak will take you through just about everything there is to know in graphic design theory, so that you become confident in your graphic design skills.

What You’ll Learn

Things you’ll learn in this course are:

  • Color
  • Contrast
  • Typography
  • Golden Graphic Design Rules
  • Justification vs. Alignment
  • Gestalt Principles
  • Hierarchy with Fonts
  • Text Color Limitations
  • Grids
  • Leading Lines
  • Negative Space
  • Focal Point
  • Propositional Density

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 16 videos. Each video involves about 10 to 15 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through video lectures only.

Institution Yes I’m a Designer
Provider YouTube
Instructor Martin Perhiniak
Level Beginner
Workload 3-4 hours
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Yes, I’m a Designer website has tons of free content such as podcasts, blog posts, and tutorials to help you in your learning journey.
  • Also, their Survival Kit for Designers landing page is one of the cutest I’ve ever seen!

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

8. Graphic Design Tips & Tricks (LinkedIn Learning)

My eighth pick for the best Graphic Design online course is Graphic Design Tips & Tricks on LinkedIn Learning.

As a graphic designer, you not only need to learn all the concepts, but also resort to tips and tricks to make the design process easier. This course will teach you several indispensable graphic design tips and tricks through simple practical examples so that you can start applying them in your designs right away.

What You’ll Learn

First, you’ll understand how to apply design principles in real situations from creating a more effective product sheet to basic visual assets for a business, and understanding the fundamentals of branding with logo, business cards, charts, signage, and simple slides.

You’ll also learn how to improve your workflow by using shapes, re-using the same picture, and transferring your look to a new format. You’ll also learn typography tips, and simple daily product designs such as stationary, brochure, magazine cover, book cover, poster, collage and more

Finally, you’ll explore more sophisticated topics such as the color wheel, Gestalt techniques, isomorphism and angles, incorporating hairlines, panoramic spacing, Swiss style grids, silhouette, softening edges, designing with black, white and gray, and alignment.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 1 module which involves about 10 to 11 hours of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, quizzes and practice exercises.

Provider LinkedIn Learning
Instructor John McWade
Level Beginner
Workload 11 hours
Enrollments 379K
Rating 4.9/5.0
Certificate Paid

Fun Facts

  • McWade has authored three books: Before & After Page Design, Graphics for Business, and How to Design Cool Stuff.
  • Before & After is known for its simple beauty, clarity of instruction, and especially its emphasis on design, not as decoration but as an essential form of communication.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

9. Graphic design mini courses from MICA (Skillshare)

My ninth pick for the best Graphic Design online course is a collection of mini courses offered by Maryland Institute College of Art on Skillshare.

Here are the two graphic design courses from MICA I have selected:

  1. Graphic Design Basics: Core Principles for Visual Design
  2. Demystifying Graphic Design: How Posters Work

Both the courses are taught by renowned designer and author, Ellen Lupton. The first course will help you build a solid foundation of core principles of graphic design in just 35 minutes. The second course focuses on poster design. It is inspired by Cooper Hewitt’s 2015 book and exhibition, How Posters Work.

What You’ll Learn

Graphic Design Basics: Core Principles for Visual Design (9 lessons)

In this course, you’ll understand symmetry vs. asymmetry, scale, framing, hierarchy, and grids.

Demystifying Graphic Design: How Posters Work (12 lessons)

In this course, you’ll learn to tell a story, activate the diagonal, simplify, overlap, focus the eye, assault the surface, visit Cooper Hewitt Smithsonian Design Museum, and create a poster.

How You’ll Learn

The courses are broken down into 9 and 12 lessons respectively. Each module involves about 5 to 10 minutes of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, readings and projects.

Provider Skillshare
Instructor Ellen Lupton
Level Beginner
Workload 2-3 hours
Enrollments 210.6K
Rating 99% (7.5K)
Certificate Not available

Fun Facts

  • Lupton is also the instructor in Graphic Design History and Methods, by MICA. This course provides a Specialist Certificate (for 300 USD) and optional college credit (for 900 USD).
  • She is the Betty Cooke and William O. Steinmetz Design Chair at MICA in Baltimore.
  • She has a whole Wikipedia page showcasing her life and career!

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.

10. Introduction to Graphic Design (LinkedIn Learning)

My tenth pick for the best Graphic Design online course is the free course, Introduction to Graphic Design on LinkedIn Learning.

This course covers both the theory and basic concepts of graphic design as well as software skills such as Photoshop, Illustrator, and InDesign. Master all the topics to get started as a graphic designer. This course also comes with a free certificate from LinkedIn Learning!

What You’ll Learn

In the first module, you’ll get an overview of the creative process. You’ll take a look at the creative brief, research, ideation, digital ideation, and production.

In the second module, you’ll take a look at the basics of layout and composition, the design space, principles of layout, grids, and layout analysis.

In the third module, you’ll explore the language of type, type terminology, type anatomy, basic type classifications, ligatures, type measurement, text elements like character and paragraph, selecting type, basic typography guidelines, and type crimes.

In the fourth module, you’ll learn about the color components, monochrome and temperature, color harmonies, RGB and CMYK, process and spot colors, color associations, and color blindness.

In the fifth module, you’ll get a Photoshop quick start tour. You’ll learn about saving a PSD file from Photoshop, making basic selections in Photoshop, placing and transforming other assets, and making and refining color selections.

You’ll also learn about selecting and refining hair strands, selectively changing colors, using content-aware scale, cropping an image, and making a black-and-white adjustment.

In the sixth module, you’ll get started with Illustrator. You’ll import a rough sketch, draw the logo, create a color theme, create point type in Illustrator, use the Touch Type tool, and Creative Cloud libraries.

In the eighth module, you’ll learn how to use InDesign. You’ll create a new document, working with master pages, import graphics into InDesign, do roundtrip editing with Photoshop, and adjust the fit of graphics.

You’ll also import text into InDesign, create text styles in InDesign, create object styles in InDesign, create tables in InDesign, finalize the design, and use InDesign Publish Online.

How You’ll Learn

The course is broken down into 7 modules. Each module involves about 30 minutes to 1 hour of work. Concepts are taught through a combination of videos, quizzes and practice exercises.

Provider LinkedIn Learning

Level Beginner

Certificate Free

Fun Facts

  • Harmer has 160+ certifications including the Adobe Creative Suite Master.
  • He frequently writes for Computer Arts magazine, and is a guest author on a number of blogs.

If you’re interested in this course, you can find more information about the course and how to enroll here.
